Table of Contents

NAME

SYNOPSIS

DESCRIPTION

duplicates an existing object descriptor and returns its value to the calling process = The argument is a small non-negative integer index in the per-process descriptor table. The value must be less than the size of the table, which is returned by The new descriptor returned by the call is the lowest numbered descriptor currently not in use by the process. The object referenced by the descriptor does not distinguish between and in any way. Thus if and are duplicate references to an open file, and calls all move a single pointer into the file, and append mode, non-blocking I/O and asynchronous I/O options are shared between the references. If a separate pointer into the file is desired, a different object reference to the file must be obtained by issuing an additional call. The close-on-exec flag on the new file descriptor is unset. In the value of the new descriptor is specified. If this descriptor is already in use, the descriptor is first deallocated as if a call had been done first.

RETURN VALUES

The value -1 is returned if an error occurs in either call. The external variable indicates the cause of the error.

ERRORS

and fail if: or is not a valid active descriptor Too many descriptors are active.

SEE ALSO

and are expected to conform to
